item.title: CLARITY Act Blazes Through House Panel 47-6, Crypto Rules Near Finish Line
item.description:
Lawmakers have edged closer to a federal crypto framework as the House Agriculture Committee has passed the CLARITY Act 47–6. The bill has clarified whether tokens fall under SEC or CFTC oversight and has progressed to the Financial Services Committee amid debates over developer protections.

The post CLARITY Act Blazes Through House Panel 47-6, Crypto Rules Near Finish Line appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Microsoft Patches 67 Vulnerabilities Including WEBDAV Zero-Day Exploited in the Wild
item.description:
Microsoft has released patches to fix 67 security flaws, including one zero-day bug in Web Distributed Authoring and Versioning (WEBDAV) that it said has come under active exploitation in the wild.
Of the 67 vulnerabilities, 11 are rated Critical and 56 are rated Important in severity. This includes 26 remote code execution flaws, 17 information disclosure flaws, and 14 privilege escalation
